intro: Spergularia fascicularis, commonly known as the clustered sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal or arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in clusters, giving it its common name. Spergularia fascicularis is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitats.
